info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 8:59AM MST until February 28 at 9:30AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Mesa County in west central Colorado... South central Garfield County in west central Colorado... * Until 930 AM MST. * At 858 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Parachute to near Palisade to 28 miles east of Castle Valley, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 28 and 91. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 51. Colorado 13 between mile markers 1 and 12. Colorado 65 between mile markers 36 and 61. Colorado 141 between mile markers 114 and 162. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction, Rifle, Palisade, Parachute, Collbran, De Beque, Mesa, Battlement Mesa, Cameo, Fruitvale, Molina, Clifton, Whitewater, Skyway, Plateau City, Orchard Mesa and Redlands. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
